intro: Cynanchica lilaciflora subsp. lilaciflora, commonly known as the lilac-flowered milkvetch, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to regions of central Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine, soft hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant lilac-colored flowers in late summer, which are arranged in racemes. Its leaves are pinnately compound, with each leaflet being elliptical and slightly hairy. The plant is adapted to dry, sunny habitats and is often found in steppe and semi-desert environments.
